website_summaries.verdict: A spray that can be used in any environment to help make cats calmer and more well-behaved.
pros: This spray is similar to cats' natural scent that they leave behind when rubbing up against people and objects at home
It can be sprayed in new environments or in cat carriers to help calm them and minimize aggressiveness
To use: spray 8 to 10 sprays in new areas or where you need your cat to be calm
cons: Some buyers reported the spray didn't work for their cat

website_summaries.verdict: The top-seller and most effective Feliway product that has helped calm the stress of many cats and their owners.
pros: Feliway's original cat-calming formula consisting of pheromones that help reduce stress and correct behavioral problems
Long lasting, and provides up to 50 applications per bottle
cons: Didn't produce noticeable results in some cats, but many more cat owners were happy with its effectiveness
Pricey, but it goes a long way

customer_reviews.title: Calm, Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I spray some Feliway on a towel and wrap my cat in it before going to the vet. Calms him down and makes him happy. Once we get to vet's, he walks around proudly with his tail in the air and side swipes everything and everybody!
customer_reviews.author: Kizmet

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: So impressed with this! I was very skeptical, but it works. My cat has a weird thing with the Christmas tree where he would get nervous and pee on our bed (it’s a thing- weird I know). I sprayed this around the tree and on the bed and he never peed again. Love that we don’t have to keep shutting out bedroom door behind us, know.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie Holochak

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe it, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff actually seems to work. I frequently travel for 6 hours +/- with my cats (16 and 18 years old) to a second home. I had been sitting in the back seat of the car to comfort them during the trips while my husband drove because one of them yowled incessantly and the other one was quiet but clearly traumatized. Recently, I had to travel alone with them and my sister recommended I try this product. I was skeptical, but tried it. They got restless by the end of the 6 hours, but were amazingly subdued most of the way without seeming drugged. I definitely recommend trying this product to help settle down cats in distress!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware....is it legit product?
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats and the 5 year old neutered Male picks on the 10 year old spayed female. I have used feliway successfully for years. I do not think this item is legit feliway. The bottle looked different....it did nothing for my cats...in fact, my female cat got very sick with focal seizures after spraying this in the house. I stopped using it and she eventually got better. I ordered the real feliway and it is working like a charm....so buyer beware of this product/vendor.
customer_reviews.author: cat lover 55

customer_reviews.title: Pheremone spray keeps kitty calm
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful product. Spray this in your cat's carrier before loading kitty in to go to the vet. Your trip will be much easier! Generous amount so bottle lasts. Have not had it stain anything I've used it on. Really does work. Use in combination with diffuser for great results.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for us!
customer_reviews.text: We love feliway in our house! It is true that not every cat responds to it, but we are on our second cat we have used it with and both have responded. The first was a Male who oddly liked to pee in one bathroom sink. Feliway helped him stop along with a little more attention. Our second is a kitten born feral. We use a few sprays on a piece of fabric at night and she is now snuggling right in with us. We also used a socialization box, etc. Feliway is not a miracle worker, but it is a fantastic tool to help the process!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy M

customer_reviews.title: Our cat avoided the area we sprayed.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat did not react well to this spray. Instead of warming up and relaxing, she avoided the area where we sprayed completely and even made a strange squinting face which leads me to believe the spray might have caused her some irritation. Now she won't go into the small cat house we got her that she was previously sleeping in. Maybe it works for other cats, but for ours, this was a bit bottle of snake oil. Also, there is no return policy for this product, so keep that in mind. For some reason, they have no problem shipping it out to you, but it's apparently a hazard to ship it back. Weird, yeah?
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Siamese cat
customer_reviews.text: Great for my crazy Siamese! Definitely calms her down. Before she acted like a crazed animal when would have visitors over.
customer_reviews.author: D. BEYERS

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny !!
customer_reviews.text: Makes my adopted feral kitten into a lovely house cat for over 8 years now. I wouldn't have been able to keep him if it hadn't calmed him down so easily. I use the plug in daily & the spray for vet & car trips or when stray cats upset him. Will continue to buy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L Morey

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have made things worse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on the strong claims it makes about reducing cat marking. I am so unhappy with this product. I believe it has actually been causing my cat to mark, as the problem has increased exponentially since beginning to use it. I figured the worst that could happen was that it would do nothing at all, but could never have imagined it would make things worse.
customer_reviews.author: ange17lica

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that meows all night and one that poops on a rug occasionally. It was recommended that I spray this on the night yowler's bed. I did and she refused to sleep in it until I washed it. Wouldn't get near it, is it didn't calm her down, it kept her away. And for the other cat, I sprayed this on the rug countless times and it hasn't stopped him from pooping on it. So yeah, complete waste of money. It is NOT eligible to return.
customer_reviews.author: J. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Works for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have very nervous rescue cats. This spray has helped with our flight from England to the USA. Moving into a new house is difficult for cats as it is let alone moving from another country. We mainly use this when people come over, redecorating, vet visits or when one of them is sick. It helps to calm and relax them when new things enter their enviroment or they are forced out of their enviroment. I find it works better than the plug in type for my cats plus this is much more portable. And yes, my cats sound posh and speak proper meow lol ;-)
customer_reviews.author: artisangirl

customer_reviews.title: I love this product but beware that it doesn’t last as long as it says!
customer_reviews.text: I think this stuff is great. It really works. However the price is really steep for the amount you get and how long it lasts. I’ve had to use it for about 4 days in a row because of a new cat in our house. I use 2 or 3 sprays an application (not like the 8 it recommends) and it’s almost gone after 12 uses! It says it should last 50 applications at 8 sprays! Crazy expensive for that amount of use!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Really works when nothing else did!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried so many things to keep my daughter's cat from ruining our new fabric sofa and easy chair. I didn't think my daughter should spend the relatively high cost for this spray since it's too late for these pieces of furniture. However, much to my surprise, Feliway actually works. Her cat--over a month later now--is still refraining from scratching the furniture, yet does not seem at all intimidated by the spray or furniture area. And we only briefly noticed a very slight odor ourselves. When we visit the relatives with this cat, we will take the spray with us. We only wish we had purchased this --Feliway--earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Erica OK

customer_reviews.title: Ok as a repellent, but for calming. No return policy!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats are repelled by the smell. It works for keeping them off furniture...for a few hours, but it does not calm them, which is what I bought it for. Now I can’t return it because of some chemical transport issue.
customer_reviews.author: Celia B

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't able to use it because it wouldn't spray.  ALso was not sealed, and bottle leaked.
customer_reviews.text: The bottle was leaking at the top under the spray nozzle, and nothing would come out of the sprayer. So I got it on my hands. Then i tried again, and it wasn't even leaking and still wouldn't spray, so I couldn't even put the leaking fluid on my hands and spread it on a sofa. The entire bottle is unusable. The box was not taped, and there was no cellophane or seal of any kind. So I can't even judge how it works. My rating is because it wouldn't spray at all.
customer_reviews.author: Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Seems Dangerous! Smells like fire.
customer_reviews.text: After a few days I smelled a strange smell in our house, like fire. I followed my nose to the diffuser. It was hot to the touch and the smell was definitely coming from it. I tried an outlet upstairs to see if if was the outlet or the diffuser. It was the diffuser. Seems dangerous. Glad I caught it before something truly bad happened. I cancelled all future orders of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Smikahl

customer_reviews.title: Great for kitties who pee outside the box -  prevention
customer_reviews.text: I use it to prevent my kitty whose litter box habits sometimes leave something to be desired. My vet told me to spray it twice a day for several days (where the kitty has peed) and then once a day. The first time I did it there was no peeing that day. I didn't keep it up and he did pee outside the box again. I started doing it correctly and the problem is no more.
customer_reviews.author: dorislt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be skeptical, this works.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Works very well for helping calm nervous cats and making them feel secure. Pictured is my 10 year old former feral who does not adapt well to new situations. That was her sprawled on the bed, toes curled, perfectly relaxed about a week into living in a new house. This was my first move incorporating Feliway and it was a roaring success.
customer_reviews.author: echo1440

customer_reviews.title: I didn't see any affects on the behavior of my cats...
customer_reviews.text: My cat sniffed the area I sprayed this in and then just walked away. I really don't think it does anything. I should have returned it because it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Try it for Yourself
customer_reviews.text: I'll stay neutral on this one, but it seems a lot of reviewer's have Cat #10........try it, it may work for You. In my Multi-Cat household, it did not "calm" anyone. The one cat that marks, thinks its a bullseye. Instructions say to use 5 pumps...........the bottle is only good for 50 applications at $11 for 60mm ..........the spray lasts 5 hrs, so you need 2 applications minimum per location............. You do the math { spendy!! }.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pump in a tiny bottle
customer_reviews.text: Such a tiny package that is supposed to be top brand at keeping the masters of the toe beans from hauling out their danger mittens and inflicting wounds upon each other’s satin fur. I have a new cat and the murder queen of my household resents the new cat with a dangerous passion, to the cost of a vet visit. We have such warriors kept separate and have been using a large bottle of another brand ,but to no avail. Harm glitters in golden eyes and new cat acts like a trees possum before a herd of hunting beagles. Bought this to keep the peace. Surprised at such a tiny bottle. 60ml? With 50 activations! This better be successful
customer_reviews.author: Speculativedryad

customer_reviews.title: my male cat of 11 years old just started spraying ...
customer_reviews.text: my male cat of 11 years old just started spraying due to stress (per Vet) of 2 new female cats. I use this after I fully clean the areas he sprays with Nature Miracle and spray the Feliway product. As of this review, he stopped spraying in the areas I treated. I have not yet used this to transport any of my cats or to stopped destruction of property but I will if that problem ever occurs, fingers cross that I will not have to us it for those purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Jean Severi

customer_reviews.title: This was like catnip to my cat and caused him to ruin ...
customer_reviews.text: This was like catnip to my cat and caused him to ruin a brand new furniture in less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Gia Samuria

customer_reviews.title: Could not believe how well it works
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I am so impressed by this product. We adopted a new kitty a little over a week ago. He was terrified and extremely stressed over being kenneled to travel in the car. He rubbed his nose raw and tore a claw on our way to his new home. We had to kennel him again for future vet appointments so we had to find something and fast. This worked so well. I sprayed it like instructions said and I put our kitty in and he wasn't immediately trying to escape and thrashing. He was way calmer than before and only meowing. This stuff really works if you have a kitty with fear of kennels.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: IT did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Felaway is a product that calmed our spraying cat down. We are thankful you saved our home and marriage. As instructions say it DID the job!
customer_reviews.author: sfreeman

customer_reviews.title: Not good for anxiety
customer_reviews.text: My anxious cat, newly brought from shelter, had just begun to socialize with us. There was a specific carpeted part of den which she would visit to say hi. Thinking it would encourage her by relieving her anxiety, I sprayed some Feliway on the rug. Now she won’t go near the area and skirts it carefully. She may think the smell belongs to another cat. I do not see how this works with cat carriers to relieve anxiety. Maybe to keep cats away from furniture, which I have not tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Truly a Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical as I had previously tried the Feliway plug ins without much luck. This spray has proven to be a miracle! We have 5 cats and the 2 oldest have been fighting and spraying urine on our rug for the last 6 months or so. We would see them do this on our security cameras and one (or both) of them would urinate on our rug nearly every night. It took about a week using the spray before it made a difference but they have not peed on the rug since! Their fighting has also decreased significantly. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: You need to read which way to plug it in or it will leak.
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, one older and very teritorial and jealous. The other is younger this keeps a balance and gives me a peaceful home and the cats a better attitude.
customer_reviews.author: sbutterfly321

customer_reviews.title: My cats are calmer.
customer_reviews.text: Calm cats, who doesn't love that. I have two cats that have been nervous since I got them. They were 8 and 9 weeks old, but they were already pretty anxious. It's been over a year and still they're skittish. When they get super anxious or fearful, I spray their cat tower and their favorite hangouts and a few minutes later, they're calmer. The only thing is that the scent dissipates and we have to keep spraying. We tried the diffuser that plugs in, but it's not as effective as this.
customer_reviews.author: Kai B.

customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much of this was the behavior change was the spray or my attempts at re-introducing two already introduced cats who were fighting because one went to the vet for a day. The aggression last for weeks and it was so stressful. I incorporated the basic reintroducing tactics and included the spray in every area they occupy, even travel cages and around beddings. It took a few more weeks but they are back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Working great with my two cats!
customer_reviews.text: I had recently purchased a new rug for my living room and my two cats became obsessed with constantly scratching it. I started using this spray on it... sprayed a couple times a day for maybe a week... and they have completely stopped scratching the rug. Even now, weeks later, after regular vacuuming, they have not started scratching it again. I have since also used the spray on the carpet on my stairs, because the cats were starting to really tear up that carpet along the edges. I only used the spray once so far on the stairs and they have stopped scratching them!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie S. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: The vet recommended it so we got it
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it actually does anything, but our cat has separation anxiety and he's on cat Prozac. The vet recommended we start using this pray too. So that's what we're doing and doubt we'll atop using it any time soon just out of fear of our cat acting out again. Some other reviewers said it has no odor, but I can slightly smell it every time I use it. It's really distinct and kinda sweet, doesn't seem to bother the cat. He avoids the spot right after I use it but he's fine after an hour or so I'm not sure if it actually calms him down since his first response is to avoid the spray all together.
customer_reviews.author: dorkface

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but helps curb scratching on furniture
customer_reviews.text: Each week as I clean and vacuum I spray this on arms of furniture and on my better rugs to keep the monsters from shredding them and it really helps. Wished it lasted a bit longer as it is pricey. But now they use the scratch post instead and the tough door mats for their claw stretching and not my good turkishrugs.
customer_reviews.author: Out there in the crazy world

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my cat from spraying!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit shocked how well this has worked. We have a rescue cat who intermittently sprayed urine at several spots in our house even though he is fixed. We tried many suggestions all to no available until we tried Feliway. Every morning I put a shot on my hand and pet him and the urine spraying stopped immediately. So grateful to have found this product! Try it!
customer_reviews.author: lpontarelli

customer_reviews.title: Good for spraying
customer_reviews.text: My stressed cat doesn't pee wherever I spray this. I reapply it in his preferred spraying areas whenever he is comes the house. He will occasionally find a new place to spray, so add that to my spot list. Takes less than a minute to walk around and spray one pump where he goes. Does not help with interspecies agression. But house doesn't smell like pee.
customer_reviews.author: juan ovakyn

customer_reviews.title: No more constant laundry! My cat has STOPPED SPRAYING THE BED AND PILLOWS!
customer_reviews.text: Really works! I have four cats and one of them pees on my bed, couch, and pillows. I had gotten samples of this from the vet but never really knew if it worked because the sample towelettes were so small. Let me tell you, by spraying this once a day or every other day (8 sprays per application) The cat has stopped his antics and I don’t have to do multiple loads of laundry per day anymore! It is worth every penny! It doesn’t have much of an odor detectable to a human nose, but it does burn my nostrils a little if I inhale it so I would recommend spraying and then walking away.
customer_reviews.author: kdipirro

customer_reviews.title: Magic water!
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this product for my cat since we were moving 7 hours away, my cat HATES car rides and it stresses him out just a 10 minute trip to the vet so I was nervous about a long road trip. But this stuff is line magic! I started using it a few days before the trip to see how it was and we sprayed the car before we left and he did amazing! Slept in the seat for the whole ride! No screaming no throwing up not pooping nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Marie vanalstyne

customer_reviews.title: Really makes a difference, especially with new cats to your home. Attracts them to special places.
customer_reviews.text: Has really helped my two new cats adapt to their new home. Has kept them from peeing where they shouldn’t, and now that they are relaxed and have adjusted to their new home, I use it to entice them to special places to sleep. Also helps if you spray it on the areas you want them to scratch, to keep them away from things they are scratching that they shouldn’t. Recommend for all cat owners!
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to everyday struggle s with cats
customer_reviews.text: I am a Veterinarian and I have been using this product at all times at work with all nervous or grumpy kittens. It works wonderful. I spray it and 5 minutes later they are more calm and let me examine them. Also, I have at home two kittens that are litter mates. They love each other but would play too rough and occasionally get mad at each other. Also, one of the was starting to spray in the house. Since I've been spraying their bed with this, they play nice and stopped spraying around. Also, they are more comfortable entering and staying in their carriers to come to work with me. Totally in love with this product.
customer_reviews.author: susana leguizamo

customer_reviews.title: Helped calm down my crazy kitten!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a new kitten. He is precious and I love him but he has SO much energy and despite how much we play with him he can still be very aggressive with us and our other cats! Within an hour or so of spraying this he was more cuddly and chill and stopped attacking our other cats. He still had plenty of energy for play time, but it's like he was able to come out of it more content and relax. I will update this review if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo good
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to be afraid to go on the living room furniture because my dog would bully him away from it. However this spray calmed both my animals down and they both sit on the couch now and I’m SO happy with the results. It worked after a few days of application. I wish it lasted longer but I don’t need as much now that I’ve shaped their behaviors and they can coexist.
customer_reviews.author: Radologist

customer_reviews.title: Not too sure if it only works with male Cats or cats that are not neutered.
customer_reviews.text: It actually seems to intensify my cats Aggression & discourtesy & make her even MORE upset & not comfortable. I say this having bought also the diffuser (Which does the same) & the Spray. Not too sure if it only works with male Cats or cats that are not neutered. But After I unplugged the Diffuser,Quit using the drops & quit spraying the "Spray", my Katy-Kat called down.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Michel Gerarrd

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used yet will follow up once I use I hope it works
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use it but I moved into my sister's home and she has forecast that I do love but I hate that they have decided to make my bed their daily kitty litter box even though they have one so once I start using it I'll do a follow-up review to make sure if it actually works because they cannot stop going to the bathroom on my bed for some odd reason let's hope it works because I am at my last resort if this does not work I will be getting rid of these cats that we've had for a long time because they cannot urinate in their box and they continue to choose my
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pulido

customer_reviews.title: This spray really works!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a constant problem of my cats scratching furniture. Just got new furniture and was determined to find something to keep them from scratching and found this spray. Can't believe how well it works. I am on my second bottle for reserve in case I need to refresh furniture. I recommend this product with enthusiasm.
customer_reviews.author: cak1948

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent and saved my rugs
customer_reviews.text: This has worked excellent for my old cat who likes to pee on anything I set on the floor. Now instead of peeing on it, she’ll just lay on it. It’s saving my rugs! This is definitely worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: The A Team

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product at my veterinarian’s suggestion. My little flame-point Siamese has started to pull her hair out in patches until she looked moth-eaten. It was determined that somehow, fleas had managed to infiltrate my apt! This stuff is very high-dollar to someone living on a fixed income, but, I figured if it worked, I’d find the money. As near as I could tell, I may as well have put out a vial of water. It did absolutely no good at all and poor little Lulu remains in discomfort. I’m now resorting to the flea treatment drops that go on her back.
customer_reviews.author: Mac191

customer_reviews.title: I think this stuff actually works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the diffuser, too. I think it actually works. My cat sometimes walks up to the diffuser and takes a whiff, after which he looks really happy. When I spray this in the carrier, he likes to look and sniff inside. I can't tell if it has stopped any bad behaviors, since I've used it from the day I adopted my cat. However, my cat hasn't scratched any of my furniture or caused much destruction around the house. He always uses his scratching post, nothing else. I've also seen the diffuser being used by my vet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hornsby

customer_reviews.title: Placebo junk
customer_reviews.text: There is no such thing as a "magic spray" to fix anxiety in cats. This spray caters to desperate cat owners who are willing to try anything to stop their cat's nervous behavior but it's a placebo and total waste of money. I should have known better. Both my cats were urinating on furniture in my house and this product did nothing to change that. I finally addressed the root cause of the issue: in our case aggressive feral cats made them feel unsafe outdoors and they started spraying their indoor territory. Trapping and neutering the feral cats helped to solve the behavior. It may seem tempting to give it a try but don't waste your money on this spray.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mahshie

customer_reviews.title: Triggers Cat spraying in some cats
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product unless you know your cat wont be triggered to continually pee everywhere!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: It makes it hard for me to breathe but also for both my cats. It caused my husband an asthma attack. The packaging was yellowed and old looking maybe it has expired or been exposed to differing temperatures and has made the product composition to change. My cat wont go near anything I sprayed with it. She hides for a few hours after spraying in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Miaschelle J

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the effectiveness for our cat
customer_reviews.text: Our vet suggested that we purchase this product to try and rectify the bad behavior our cat has been displaying over the past month or so. He is urinating outside of his litter boxes. After trying all the suggestions to keep at least 2 boxes in different spots and to keep them impeccably clean, etc. etc. he continued to use the carpets around the house and even a bed which was the last straw for me. I have tried the product according to the instructions but we have not had any positive results as yet. We will continue and if there is any change in his behavior we will definitely adjust the review.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for us
customer_reviews.text: We have used this before so bought the larger bottle. We had 3 cats and two were wetting in a variety of locations. Once we went down to two cats, I thoroughly cleaned rugs/carpets that had been stained and then used Feliway. We have not had any problems since. I know one of the kitties that stayed with us was pottying on rugs because I saw her do it. Since using this product that has stopped. Am delighted!
customer_reviews.author: E Fowkes

customer_reviews.title: With great relief, it worked!
customer_reviews.text: Really skeptical...read other reviews...had to try something...it REALLY worked! Aggressive male was constantly attacking other 3 (1 a few weeks older, other 2 a few weeks younger). It was too much—separating cats, litter boxes, food & water. Everyone simply had to get along. It took a few days of spritzing living space (I did it twice a day) and the change in temperament was so evident, I wish I had taken a day-by-day video! I’m so glad I tried this product. It is a bit pricey. My kitty-living space is quite large & spritzed nearly the whole bottle that first trial. Since it produced the desired effect, very worth $ spent. Would definitely recommend & gift to others.
customer_reviews.author: J K.

customer_reviews.title: A Product that Didnt Work!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could spray this on a cat to find out you spray it in areas. I was just trying to calm 2 cats that just met. Neither cat woukd lie in the areas i sprayed this ??? Im not sure why as Ive read it is a great product ... i sprayed it around edges of bed and playhouse where they were fighting and then they just moved to other areas to fight and layed down in other areas to sleeo and play till it wore off few days later.i did not over spray - the directions couldve been clearer though. I feel I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: james Byrge

customer_reviews.title: It made no difference in my hard to handle cat
customer_reviews.text: Our vet specialist recommended this for our very difficult to handle Maine Coon. Giving her medication is like medicating the cat from Pet Cemetery! We followed the instructions to the letter, but it had absolutely no effect on her whatsoever... I tried it, it didn’t work, and won’t buy again. I don’t recommend this product for edgy cats.
customer_reviews.author: wenracr

customer_reviews.title: Bottle leaking when arrived - not able to return
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product yesterday and I have used Feliway products before. When I opened the box, the bottle was leaking around the metal ring. The contents were all over the bottle and it was missing quite a bit. Any time you push the spray nozzle is also pushes quite a bit of spray out from the metal ring. I like the product but the bottle is defective. I will not buy again due to amazons return policy: "This item isn't eligible for return For safety reasons, items containing flammable liquids or gases can’t be returned to Amazon. For more information or help, please contact us."
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: This Works!
customer_reviews.text: My husband brought in a stray one cold cold winter night... until then there was peace and harmony with our other 4 cats. Our male took an instant dislike to the "intruder" and tore into her. Since then I had a problem with her peeing in very inappropriate places.... bed, living room carpet, etc. I had the difusers but as much as they helped it didn't cure the problem. I started using the spray on the areas that our girl peed on and instantly she stopped! I spray areas daily that she has soiled before.... no more problem. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Rhode

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because the vet I go to use it and it made my cat happier than I’ve ever seen her. Considering she’s a geriatric old cat I want to give her everything to make her comfortable I can and as soon as I got home I ordered this. The product seems to be working as described although not as a effectively as I did at the vet which might just mean she actually like to going there-but the product was in great shape it worked as described and compared to other sources this is a great value for the price. I’ve tried other brands of cat pheromones and this brand is by far my cats favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Kallie

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this for my cat who was peeing on my carpet in my basement. She always went to the same spot. She would run away when I sprayed it on my hands for her to smell. I tried sprayed it on the spot she peed on and she continued to pee in the same area. I ended up pulling up all of my carpet in the basement and now my problem is solved and since then hasn’t peed in the house other than her litter box. I’m sure this does work for other cats, just unfortunately not mine.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Haven't noticed a huge decrease in anxiety
customer_reviews.text: We have a kitten that has recently started going into heat. I purchased this in the hopes of helping her calm down until we get her to the vet. I sprayed it on her bed and around the rooms she seems to favor. I haven't noticed much of a decrease in her anxeity during her heat cycle. She does howl less than before, but was hoping for more calmness for her. Poor thing. Maybe it's user error.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Can have a profound effect on cat's stress level. As a vet I use this for every cat appointment and will apply to the bedding and cage for in-patients, and spray towels to drape over traps of feral cats. I have a lot of clients shocked when there cat calms down and starts rolling around purring on the exam table after I give them a chance to relax and enjoy the pheromones. Not every cat is impacted but I will still use it every time. Also available in wipes (Great for carriers), and plug ins.
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Did NOTHING.... if anything made worse
customer_reviews.text: Did absolutely nothing. I am still debating if it made the problem worse as the cat urinated exactly where I sprayed the feliway within hours. After the first try I gave up. Seeing that the first attempt did nothing to stop the problem and may have even added to the problem I was not interested in trying again.
customer_reviews.author: willy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: The Ceva brand of Feliway is helping a lot. I spray an apron and they purr while I groom. I spray a towel and they sleep in their carrier while traveling. I sprayed strips of fabric and tied around the dogs’ necks to do the first intro and everyone is still alive.
customer_reviews.author: R.I.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my crew!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bit of a cat problem - 8 cats total and a few are from sketchy situations but they are all very much loved and taken good care of. I got this originally for my one guy who was never socialized the first 8 years of his life. He's been with me two years now and he is dramatically less stressed! Gone is the over grooming and I see WAY fewer spats and even my old crotchety man (from the humane society) is less cranky when these are going. If you have a multi cat household or an anxious kitty I would highly recommend you try these.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Brewer

customer_reviews.title: 5* cat deterrent
customer_reviews.text: Best cat deterrent I have ever used in 30 years of having cats. The cats won't go anywhere near anything I sprayed even 7 days later. Won't use this as a calming ingredient for travel or grouchy cats but will keep on hand for areas i don't want cats like closets laundry tabletops. Disappointed that it was not as effective for my 4 cats as catnip. But pleasantly surprised at deterrent efrect. Beats spray bottles of water or banging cans around or even saying no. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work!
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work! My 4 year old neutered cat recently started peeing on the wall in front of his normal potty spot and I took him to the vet no urinary infection she recommended this I cleaned the area like it said and have been spraying 9 sprays twice daily as directed and he's still going there! Super expensive for a tiny bottle and I've been using for 5 days and no progress! And I only half left! I would think a vet recommended and good reviewed product would atleast show a little progress be now but nope!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: this is the emperor's clothes.  It doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have an indoor fearful, feral cat, and this did nothing. Nothing. I tried the plug in atomizer, and yes, it DOes get really really warm to the touch, so that is worrisome. I also tried spritzing the bottle spray of feliaway around at times, nothing. Zero change. I suspect those who report their cat seemed more relaxed, were observing a cat who did become relaxed because of TIME wore off his anxieties about whatever it was he was unaccustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer33333

customer_reviews.title: This does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on what a vet recommended because my older 2 cats started peeing in strange places and the vet could find no physical/medical issues with either cat. Figured it was from the construction happening in the house and changes in litter box placement. But the cats were supposed to like to lay in a place where this has been sprayed and ironically the cats will lay anywhere but where this has been sprayed. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: DP76

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Feliway is a staple in our home. It stops cat fights. I spray it on favorite scratching spots that shouldn't be scratched. For nail trimming time, I spray it on my shirt and it relaxes them. When it's Vet time, I spray it on the cat bed inside the crate. Never spray it on the cat. We HAVE to have Feliway in our home.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kunisch

customer_reviews.title: Was this product already used?
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it came not even filled to the top. If I weren’t leaving on a trip and needed it, I would return it and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: AmakalaEunice

customer_reviews.title: Works, works, works.
customer_reviews.text: Paid Double the price at the Vet. This stuff does work! I had to introduce a third cat to two resident cats and this definitely calms them down.
customer_reviews.author: a_matter_of_principle

customer_reviews.title: Buy the plug in
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray on the pee spots my cat was leaving on the carpet (after we cleaned it up). I followed the directions but it didn't seem to do much. I also got the plug in which I think actually resolved our problem. Plus my husband couldn't stand the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us....actually increased anxiety and non-returnable
customer_reviews.text: The spray didn't work for us. Our cat's anxiety was actually increased because she could feel and smell the product on her coat. It caused her to groom incessantly until she had fully removed the product, thus ingesting it. We tried spraying directly on her coat (which she didn't appreciate at all) and by first applying to our hands and then petting it on to her (as instructed by our vet). Neither with success. Finally, we also tried to spray it on one of her 'bedding' places, but now she avoids that spot. The bow on top is that the product is non-returnable to Amazon because it's flammable. I should have bought it locally to give it a try instead.
customer_reviews.author: donniesoprano

customer_reviews.title: This works for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but issues with my cat peeing on my dog's beds. The vet recommended this spray to me, and I believe it works for my cat. The only issue is how often you have to spray. It says it only lasts for a few hours, which is frustrating to be constantly remembering to spray this. I also think it is very expensive for the amount. It does work, but like I said, I have to spray multiple times a day. I also don't like the smell of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wesorick

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 Chance
customer_reviews.text: I have a MaineCoon male cat about one year old. Hes a wonderful pet but he tends to get aggressive towards our female ragdoll cat who doesn't have it coming.. You start salt playing in turns into very aggressive domination very heartbreaking to watch. This spray (if you can get your cat to smell it)-somewhat helps the situation . It's not a cure all but it does tend to settle him down a little bit for about an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G.G

customer_reviews.title: It works on my kitten
customer_reviews.text: I think it may not work on one of my cats because she has breathing problems but she's also not the one that I need to keep away from stuff. I use this when my young boy cat gets into an area that might not be safe for him as he likes to chew on cords and anything else he can fit in his mouth. It's hard to cat proof the entire house so this helps ensure his safety. I spray it, he gets a whiff and runs away.
customer_reviews.author: jill sutton

customer_reviews.title: Not really convinced that this spray works
customer_reviews.text: I really haven't seen any evidence that this works yet. I also did use it to try to help my cats get along by spraying it all around there area where they get introduced and did so as directed, and it just wasn't effective for us. But it could be that the outlet plug-in is more efficient for that. I'll know for sure if it helps when I bring my cat to the next vet visit, and I use it inside the carrier. But as of now, I haven't seen any differences in my cats for anything I've used it for. Feliscratch has worked though, and I DO recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Strong scent for humans, but kitties were calm
customer_reviews.text: Used this while moving with my cats. Really strong scent my SO and I both coughed intensely over, but it mellowed out. Cats were calm in their carriers and we also used it to get them used to our new home the first week and to keep them from starting to scratch up some new furniture we bought. We haven't had to respray those pieces luckily. There's still half the bottle left after using excessively to test it, travel for a few days, and then settle into the house and coat the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: invertedcharisma

customer_reviews.title: Feliway spray works, must reapply...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, my cats were going after the Christmas tree, a few longer curtains , and a loveseat, a quick spray of this stuff and they backed off for a few days. Definitely have to reapply. It made the dog sneeze though when he walked nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Weitzel

customer_reviews.title: Might be a dupe.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was half full. Yeah, I read the reviews. Yeah I didn’t think it would work (I was right), yeah I took the chance anyway. I was desperate and now I’m desperate and face palming myself. It doesn’t work, if anything it makes my cat worse and want to bounce off the walls. And like I said, it was HALF FULL. My vet recommended this, but I’m thinking it might be a dupe. Buy from the website, not this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Bottle not full at all
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet but the bottle came missing almost 1/4th if it’s contents. I feel like I should be given a full bottle, not a partial bottle! Really sad about this.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful for anxious cats
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats and this helps a lot for vet visits or when people are over for dinner so my cats don’t get so anxious. Also for calming everyone down when it’s time for bed. It only lasts a few hours so I went ahead and got a plug-in diffuser but the spray is still helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Helps calm kitties
customer_reviews.text: This product helps my two male indoor cats get along without any dominance issues. I used to have a problem where the alpha cat would bully the smaller one and he would retaliate by marking his territory on my blanket. Since I started using the pheromone spray I’ve been able to drastically reduce this behavior and the cats seem much calmer and more zen. I’m on my 3rd bottle and will continue buying this because it works!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Excelleny
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful product for animals when they're under any kind of stress or have to travel. I sprayed around the house and they will gravitate to that spot. it's wonderful if you're introducing something new into the house such as the new pet or new baby. I just wish they made one for people....
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work in my household
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give this only 3 stars because it may work for some cats. Sadly, it didn't for mine. There was still tension between them (4 cats) and one spayed female still urine marked around windows. In all fairness, I do have a small house (can create tension among cats) and there are a couple of neighborhood cats that bother the one cat that sprays. Due to these circumstances, Feliway wasn't my solution.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a problem with Kitty peeing on my bed. Had him checked out by vet. Have the plug-in of this and used this spray on top cover of bed. It's been several days and no pee!! YEA!!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Woman

customer_reviews.title: I probably wouldn’t buy again as I still had to spend a good portion of the car ride trying to soothe my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used for traveling on a 3 hour car ride with 2 cats who both get upset in the car and panic. It worked about 50% of the time and I still had plenty leftover after our trip. I probably wouldn’t buy again as I still had to spend a good portion of the car ride trying to soothe my stressed cats. Not saying it won’t work for others but my cats get so stressed during car rides they start to pant, next time I’m just gonna go to the vet and get sleep medicine.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I works! Really it does!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first that anything would help my seriously shy cat. We adopted her and she is a mess of nerves that would not come near us and hides 23 1/2 hours a day. Seriously. Well ONE application of this spray and she was all over me like gum stuck to my shoe. Splayed out on top of me purring away. When it wears off she's back to hiding but she's coming out more when I use the spray. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Orla A. Nickell

customer_reviews.title: Works only as a Repellent
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian promoted this item to me as a way to calm my cat's stress levels. This doesn't calm any stress levels because it is a repellent! I was advised to spray onto my cat's bed and other areas in order for her stress levels to decrease. Now she won't go near any sprayed area and her behavior has increased in stress because she's upset that all her areas are not approachable. This item is great as a repellent but should not be marketed as a calming agent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Not a dramatic difference after using
customer_reviews.text: I also use feliway diffusers. Not really convinced how effective feliway is, but my veterinarian highly recommends it. I thought that perhaps the spray would help and while it did not make the situation worse, I can not see an improvement. Guess my advice is that if you are going to travel or are seeing a positive outcome from feliway diffusers in your home then this might make a positive impact. For me, this did not make much if any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Nutsie

customer_reviews.title: my cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: i sprayed this on our cats towel that she liked right when we got her from the shelter to help calm her down. She took one sniff of it and literally ran away and now she hates that towel. Dont know if ill try it for other things now. Seems like it has a negative effect.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Powell

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS !
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with the product and the way it works. My poor Kitty seems to be afraid of his own shadow, and I have no Idea why ! Anyway, I spray 2 or 3 sprays around the room and you can see him start to relax. Especially if I've had friends over. Kitty's been under my bed the whole time, ( Of course) It seems to take the "scent" of my friends away, and calm him down. I wish there was more I could do for my scared Little Chunky Monkey 😁 I did also buy a diffuser, but haven't tried it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Bought another one.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works pretty good. The cats don't fight as much and most of the scratching has stopped. Its a bit pricey for the size but compared to buying new furniture I cant complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: cammy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading it could help relieve anxiety in cats, while also helping with unwanted cat spraying. Unfortunately, after using this as directed, I probably added more stress to my cat. I sprayed some on her favourite bench to lay on and on her first sniff jumped off and avoided the bench for a couple of weeks. It's taken probably a month for her to get back on the bench. I guess it's a bit of contradictory product - something that makes cats stay away from an area yet you need them to be around the product to inhale and get the benefits. Idk....buyer beware on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. We have three cats, one has a nervous disposition and another has dementia. Inappropriate urinating is an ongoing issue, but if I use this regularly we have no issues at all. We also have tons of neighbor and feral unfixed males that love to come spray our front door and windows. I started giving the areas they tag a quick squirt and we haven;t been marked since! Totally unexpected bonus! For urination issues you have to use it daily! Seriously, follow the directions! You can't just use it once and expect it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Morae

customer_reviews.title: Coco's happier now!
customer_reviews.text: I introduced a stray kitty into my household. He was jumping on my 12 year old kitty and wouldn't stop no matter what I tried. My vet suggested I try spraying a fabric pull apart collar on both of them. I use it twice a day. It calms him down a lot. If he goes without, he jumps her right away. Glad I found this stuff and so is Coco 😺
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Does its job and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, it seemed like a little of the liquid evaporated or sat on a shelf for too long. The box was a little crushed in the corner but the bottle itself was plastic and unharmed. I bought it because my cats were marking sporadically around the house. After I would clean the area, I wait a few minutes then use this spray. So far, out of 4 spots, they only marked one spot, therefore I would say it does what it's supposed to and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanna

customer_reviews.title: Feliway to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: This product worked to ease the anxiety of my new shelter kitten in his new home as well as traveling to the vet. I sprayed it on my new bedspread and leather couches and he doesn't scratch there to mark his territory. It also helped calm an older cat I watch calmly interact with my kitten. This is the 2nd bottle I've bought and continue to but to keep cats calm. Compared to retail stores and the vet, price is 70% less from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: CaL

customer_reviews.title: Stressed my cat out more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of my vet to try and avoid medicating my cat. We were going on a road trip across country. Unfortunately, it just caused her stress and anxiety to sky rocket. Thankfully, I tried just this on a 30 minute car ride instead of just trusting it would help and dealing with a stressed out, crying kitty for two 12 hour days of driving. I do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall S.

product_meta.title: FELIWAY Spray
product_meta.description: Size:60 mlIs your cat peeing outside the litter box, scratching your furniture and carpet, or hiding on a regular basis? These behaviors may be caused by fear or anxiety. FELIWAY products are a vet recommended, drug free, and clinically proven to help alleviate many of the unwanted behaviors cat owners deal with. FELIWAY Spray provides “happy messages” by mimicking the natural feline reassuring messages (pheromones) to make cats feel calm and comfortable at home. This product has been found to reduce scratching, spraying, and hiding for 90% of cats, and many owners see results within 7 days. Cats are also very sensitive to change, so if you anticipate changes in the home (moving, renovation, recorating, new pets, new family members, etcs.), FELIWAY is very effective in helping your cats remain calm, and adapt to the changes without unwanted behaviors. If you are having issues with spraying (peeing), after cleaning urine-affected areas, spray FELIWAY directly onto the urine marks, as well as onto other prominent objects including furniture, drapes, window frames and doorways. This helps your cat to feel calm, and reduces unwanted behaviors caused by anxiety (like peeing outside the litterbox). This will also help them to stop scratching and hiding as well. Feliway Spray is completley safe for both humans, and your cat - it is odorless and colorless. Spray away the fear, and feel calmer today!
feature_bullets: VET RECOMMENDED: Feliway is the #1 vet recommended solution to help cats adjust to challenging situations and curb stress related unwanted behaviors
REDUCES SCRATCHING AND URINE SPRAYING: Clinically proven to reduce scratching and urine spraying in 9/10 cats. Results may be seen as early as 7 days
EFFECTIVE FOR 90% OF CATS: Great for on the go use, or spot treatment at home - you can spray calming pheromones directly onto objects, your car, or cat carrier
EASE THE STRESS of a new environment, loud noises (thunder, fireworks, etc), travel, vet visits, and more
DRUG FREE SOLUTION: Our spray mimics natural pheromones, which helps to put cats at ease in a natural and safe way

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
